core.disclaimerMessage: Disclaimer This software is for research purposes only.
core.notAccessibleMessage: The requested session "{{id}}" was not found or is not accessible.
core.possibleReason1: requested a temporary session that is already expired
core.possibleReason2: tried to access a temporary session of another user
core.possibleReason3: tried to access a private persistent session of another user
core.contactOwnerMessage: In the latter two cases, please contact the original owner of the session to create a public persistent session.
core.timeoutMessage: Your data request could not be completed. Therefore, it was cancelled. This problem might have been caused by requesting too much data at once. In case of any questions, please contact the administrator.

utilsInternal.notAllowed: Not Allowed, please contact your system administrator
utilsInternal.publicMsg: Public (everybody can see and use it)
utilsInternal.definePermissions: define which are the default permissions for other users to access this item
utilsInternal.specifyRole: specify a group / role which you are part of that should have extra rights, such as a group of administrators
utilsInternal.buddiesPlaceholder: list of usernames separated by semicolon
utilsInternal.buddiesDescription: Buddies are a list of user names that can have advanced rights, such as backup administrators

editDialog.dialog1: This dialog allows you to save the list of currently shown entities without any extra data. Afterwards, you can start new analyses using this entity subset by selecting it on the start page.
editDialog.dialog2: However, if you want to save the entire analysis session and not only the list of entities, please use the dialog Analysis Session Management at the top.
editDialog.name: Name

SessionList.name: Name
SessionList.creator: Creator
SessionList.sessionMessage: A temporary session will only be stored in your local browser cache.It is not possible to share a link to states of this session with others. Only the {{latest}} most recent sessions will be stored.
SessionList.paragraphText: The persistent session will be stored on the server.By default, sessions are private, meaning that only the creator has access to it.If the status is set to public, others can also see the session and access certain states by opening a shared link.
